page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY
page.content:
{CIRENCESTER PARK.} { "ALFRED'S HALL",ANOTHER FOLLY,IS A PSEUDO-GOTHIC STRUCTURE NEAR THE JUNCTION OF THE TEN RIDES. IT WAS ONE OF THE FIRST 'GOTHIC' BUILDINGS AND STARTED A FASHION. THE WINDOWS ARE SAID TO BE AUTHENTIC 15TH CENTURY AND MAY HAVE BEEN REMOVED FROM SAPPERTON CHURCH WHEN IT WAS RESTORED.
IT WAS THOUGHT TO HAVE BEEN {THE PLACE WHERE KING ALFRED,DISGUISED {AS A MINSTREL, LISTENED TO THE DANISH {PLANS OF ATTACK. THE DANES CAPTURED {CIRENCESTER IN THE NINTH CENTURY.} A LOCAL LEGEND IS THAT IT WAS THE PLACE WHERE HE BURNT THE CAKES AFTER HIS DEFEAT.
